Name: Make The Beast
Descriptions: Make a robot from scratch with given resources and complete the challenge.
Rules: Each team must have at least one and at most four members
Each team will be provided with system having Arduino IDE. Contestants are not allowed to use their own personal computers
Aurdino coding is prerequisite
Participants are not allowed to bring their own Arduino kit/ peripheral hardware
Any malpractice would lead to disqualification
The type of robot, specifications and the task to be performed will be disclosed only by the beginning of the event
More sophisticated rules related to the particular robot and the task will be disclosed only along with the specifications
Cross college teams allowed
All students with a valid identity card from their respective educational institution and a valid DYUKSHA ID are eligible to participate in the event
Decision of organizers will be ﬁnal and binding on all
The organizers have full rights to call off the event if the required number of entries are not met, if that is the case the registered participants will be informed at the earliest

Change in rules, if any will be highlighted on the website and notiﬁed to the registered teams

ROUNDS
Round 1: Participants will be given the said equipments and they have to build a robot and code the Arduino which will perform the task (which will announced by the beginning of the round)

Round 2: Participants will be asked to make necessary changes to the existing code and hardware of the robot to perform a more advanced task

JUDGING CRITERIA
Code efficiency and logic
Time taken to complete the robot
Parameters depending on the robot. Some parameters will be dependent on the functioning of the constructed robot. These parameters will be disclosed just before beginning the round
Construction neatness of the robot body
All these parameters will result into corresponding points and accumulation of all these points will result into the final score
Decision of the judges will be the final
